headline: Super Easy Egg Casserole
description: Baked egg casserole that's super easy to make and delicious. Beaten eggs are baked with Cheddar cheese, bell pepper, bacon, green onions, and garlic.

video.description: Delicious egg casserole that’s perfect for the weekend.
video.name: Super Easy Egg Casserole

name: Super Easy Egg Casserole
recipeIngredient: 0.5 teaspoon minced garlic, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix eggs, cheese, bacon, bread, red bell pepper, green onion, milk, garlic, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until well-combined; pour into the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, about 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It was easy to make and you can substitute it with any kind of meat and cheese. Just enough for three adults or 2 adults and two grandkids. Little granddaughters loved it. Thanks for the recipe. A &D
I added rice wine vinegar to soy sauce and Chinese 5 spice seasoning. Used a bag of mixed cruciferous veggies and carrots
This was so so good I will definitely make it again.
Turned out perfect in a small baking dish! Used garlic powder, onion powder and cubed ham. Baking time approximately 30 minutes.

This was very easy + flavorful. I used what I had like regular onion + green pepper + store bought real baconbits. It's great recipe for substituting what you have on hand. I'm going to try using cinnamon bread next time for different flavor. Easy + yummy ! (It would need to be doubled for 9x13 dish...I suggest using a smaller casserole dish than 9x13)

Amazing and super easy! I didn’t cook the bacon beforehand and was worried when reading reviews.. I just chopped into small pieces..but it turned out YUMMY! This will be a staple in our house. Can substitute so many veggies and make enough for a crowd if needed. LOVE!!

I liked that this didn't call for potatoes, sausage, or an overnight stay in the fridge. It is good, but not enough volume to fill a 9x13. You'd need to double for that. I believe the bacon needs to be cooked, sobI cooked mine first. I didn't have green onion, so sautéed regular and the bell pepper in the bacon grease. Put it in an 8x11 dish and baked for 28 minutes.
Excellent! I did trade out the onion and peppers for a mild pico in order to save a little time.

This was very good. I've made a lot of breakfast casseroles and I'm not sure that the bread in this one had any wow factor (couldn't really taste it). I made as per the recipe but used a small yellow onion instead of green, which I fried first and, as others suggested, a thin layer of frozen hash browns along the bottom of the pan, which I put in the oven while it was preheating and I was mixing the other ingredients. And, of course, I cooked the bacon first. Was this good? Yes! Would I make it again or serve to company? Yes! Was it amazing? No. There's a few other breakfast casseroles that rank higher.

First, I fried the bacon until crispy before adding. Same with green peppers and green onions. Half a teaspoon of raw garlic in the egss was way too much and overpowered everything else. Garlic is good for this recipe, but I'd reduce it to 1/3 tsp and fry it with the bacon and green peppers instead. So, the recipe as it stands is pretty bad, but it can be fixed easily enough.

This sounded great! I wish I had read the reviews before I made it. The bacon should be cooked ahead then added. I halved the recipe and put it in a small casserole dish which made it much thicker, which was nice. Maybe add a little more onion.
Great recipe! I added hash browns on the bottom of the dish and then poured the egg mixture over it - baked it and enjoyed!

It was very yummy and easy! The only alterations I made was, I used dark rye, seedy bread and a fiesta cheese blend. To my surprise it came out perfect. You could easily use a smaller pan and adjust the baking time.
I doubled the recipe and it was a hit!!
Easy and good
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??

EASY is spot on! I loved this recipe and so did my family. Great flavor and very little prep made this a great "quick" breakfast. I made it and it fed my family of four (4) perfectly with no leftovers. The only thing I would suggest as a minor change to recipe, is to mix everything BUT the bread first. Then after everything is mix really good, then add the bread. Only because the bread sucks up so much of the liquids before you can get everything good and coated. that is it! Things I changed: I precooked the bacon, peppers, and onions before I baked the casserole. I didn't full on cook everything, just enough to get it started, I was just worried that twenty (20) minutes wasn't enough time to cook (to my liking) the bacon. I used a cast iron pan, so I just left (most) of the bacon grease in the pan (instead of greasing it) and just mixed everything up in the bowl, then reused the pan to bake it in the oven. The recipe seems very versatile, where you can add just about anything to your liking, and it will still taste great! I will definitely make this again.
Simple, flexible and really good. I recommend cooking the bacon a bit before adding.

I used rye bread, cheddar and 4 cheese Mexican mix. I also added sliced mushrooms. It was delicious and better the 2nd day. 
Next time I would not use 1/2as much bread, as it took away from the egg and cheese flavors.

This was very easy and didn’t take long. I made it on the spur of the moment. I think the 9x13 baking dish is too large for the contents. I will make it again, but will use a smaller baking dish. It was good.

Had I made this according to recipe it probably would have been awesome, but I got greedy and wanted onion in there so I diced up an entire yellow onion and it made it too chunky.
I also mixed it up the night before but had no bread, so I diced up some fresh baked slices the next day then spread them on the pan and poured the mixture over top. I also put 1/2 the cheese in, then sprinkled the other half on top and put it under the broiler for an additional 5 minutes. 
The onion is the only change I regret.
My husband loved it. I used white cheddar and left out the bell pepper and onion

Made it for a faculty breakfast.everyone really enjoyed it. I didn’t have any bread (we are going no gluten these days) but had left over Trisquit crackers so I used them! It actually worked great snd added a nice little flavor

Easy to make and so flavorful! My husband was dubious about this one (he dislikes casseroles), but even he went back for seconds. I added some tomatoes fresh from my garden, and it really complimented the flavors. I also used duck eggs as opposed to chicken eggs, which made it extra creamy with that gourmet feel. This was a fun, simple dish to make.

Was delicious. Added alot of extra veggie like we would put into our omelettes. Added cinnamon and season salt. I used 8 eggs instead of 6. I was going to use bagels which i will next time right now i used oatmeal bread. I precooked the bacon and sausages and added extra cheese and used vidalia onion instead. May go with other comments are try hashbrowns at the bottom. Should i cook these first?
No garlic. Used chopped green chilis instead of bell pepper. Sprinkled cheese on top right out of the oven and served with sour cream and salsa. Delish!

i read all of the comments first. when i was mixing ingreds in the bowl, it looked a bit too dry, so i added 2 more eggs. i taste tested just a corner of it, tasted dry, so i spread some shredded cheese and butter on it. PERFECT!

I did make this dish with a few slight changes for my families taste. first I doubled the recipe, then I whisked the eggs separately, fried my bacon (more than recipe called for because I have a family of meat eaters), and used Artesano bread, I did not have any fresh bell peppers but did have a bag of frozen onions/peppers which I pan fried with the green onions and garlic, then added all the ingredients together in a butter 9 x 13 glass dish as recipe states. Baked at 350F for 40 mins and it came out great!

Our family will be keeping this recipe, and I would like to thank all those before me whom put in their thoughts about this recipe to help me know how and what to do to get this recipe perfect for us. :-)

Easy to make, easy to ad lib (added froz, thawed drained spinach, used cooked bacon, omitted peppers & shredded one potato finely & squeezed out liquid, layered potatoes on bottom of pan and cooked ‘em a bit 1st). It is in the oven as I type. Smells great. Hope to update after we eat.
I did precook the bacon.
Making my omelette is better

This was delicious! The directions did not mention whether to cook the bacon first, but I did, in the oven, to not-quite-crispy. Then I diced the six slices and continued with the recipe. I assume the size of the pan is critical, so if you are making this for more than 4 people, you would need to use two pans.

I added a hand full of tator tots, used green and red peppers, omitted green onions for a little regular onion and added an extra egg or two because of the tator tots. It was awesome! I will add fresh basil as well.

This was a great base recipe, but 6 eggs didn't come close to filling a 9x13. I added 6 eggs and doubled the milk and bread to make this more fitting for the pan. I also used precooked bacon instead of making it. With the changes, it was much more accurate. It was good, but downsize the pan if you don't change it.
I cant submit a photo but it was delicious

Good recipe, but you need to pre-warm the bacon in the microwave, or at least let it get to room temperature before adding. I did not, and the bacon was seriously under -done in the center. Had to cook the dish an extra five minutes which made the top too firm and crusty. My bad.
Absolutely delicious! I followed the recipe exactly and everyone loved it. 4 of us almost finished it, luckily there is some left for later on!

Eggcellent recipe. Used the following based on what I had on hand. Used 1.5 C eggbeaters. Had three small bell peppers from garden, sautéed them in oil with onions and Canadian bacon. Half of small onion. And 6-8 slices of Canadian bacon diced. Worked great with gluten-free bread.
Will use again and again -- so adaptable.

Amazing recipe. I added sautéed sliced white mushrooms and used 8 x 8 pan. I baked longer than the time suggested. Didn’t time how long. I used sliced brioche bread. I also added red and yellow peppers instead of just red and used more than suggested.

I added:1/4 cup shredded cheese2 eggs1 med red potato, skinned and shreddedGreen pepper, diced2 slices of applewood smoked ham - I substituted:Yellow onion instead of green- I modified:Only had two slices of turkey bacon Very easy to make and super yummy!!
Super easy and quick. I didn't have green onion instead used a yellow. Used chopped cheddar cheese sticks as I was out of shredded cheese.
Added some Parika, mushrooms, jalapeños and some Italian sausage
I made this egg casserole and my husband really liked it! I thought it needed more cheese on top. Will make it again.

I quadrupled this for 13 people. So it called for 24 eggs. I had only a little bit left. I cooked it in a deep 13x 9 pan. I used 1 pound cooked ground breakfast sausage and about 1/2 pound bacon. I added 4 large cups of cheese. I cooked it for 45 minutes and then 5 more minutes to melt extra cheese on top. I used a small regular onion which was perfect. Some of the group said they never had it without hash browns in the recipe and were surprised at how good it was. I don't like hash browns.

Super Easy is correct.. First time making it today for Father’s Day.. I never follow the recommended recipe.. I always read the reviews & tweak it to my own.. Stick with the basics.. eggs, 2 slices of bread - cubed, cheese, milk, onion powder & pepper.. then add anything you want.. Today I added sausage, bacon, red onion & a can of mushrooms.. always cook your ingredients first then mix them in the egg mixture.. spray your baking dish with cooking spray.. I used a square 8x8 baking dish, cover with foil, bake at 365 for 45 min.. Turned out delicious.
I, like some others found out that the 9 x 13 pan makes it way to thin! All I could taste was the bread at the bottom. Not much flavor. My family thought it was okay but I did not.

Given I tweaked this recipe a bit to match our personal tastes and what we had in the kitchen already.. it was fantastic. I'm not personally a fan of onions or peppers in the morning so I omitted those. I also used brioche bread that I baked last week instead of white bread. Lastly I used some diced sausage that I precooked/browned and doubled the recipe. Yes I changed quite a few things but they just goes to show you can really tweak this to your family's taste! Definitely will try this again.
I agree the casserole is thin so a smaller dish or double the recipe but the flavor was great. This will be a regular in the freezer.
I added some gourmet Italian cheese...wow!
Loved this! The only thing was that I had no green onions so I substituted it with regular onions, and simply put less onions. Overall, this dish was beautiful and so easy!
Added pan sausage
Amazing!!!! Made this at the firehouse for Sunday breakfast, thanks for the recipe.....been asked to make it again, and even for lunch and dinner!!!! Soooo much flavor too
Super easy to make, however made my own pie crust. My husband loved it.

Super easy to make and the family loves it. Leave out or add in what ever to like to make it the flavor you want. I didn't have much of the ingredients because we are sitting in isolation and stores are sold out of a lot. Made it with just eggs, bread, cheese, and bacon bits, the put salt on it once on the plate. Will be experimenting slot with this one.

Loved it! Recipe was straight forward and easy to adjust. Only critique was it calls for too large a dish, probably 8x11 would work better. Taste was still great and dish was pretty, even if a bit thin!

This is delicious but I doubled the ingredients and made it in the 9 x 13. I baked it for 25 minutes and it was perfect. 

My family loved it and we will be making it again. 

The only other change I made was to use freeze dried peppers, onions and green onions. Because of this I added about 1/3 cup of water to make up for the liquid needed for the veggies.
Everyone loved it! Recipe feeds 4.
Family couldn’t get enough!!

love this recipe, easy and everyone loves it. I have been putting frozen hash browns at bottom of pan and a whole bag of bacon, which I cook first. I also add some red pepper flakes for a little kick but I like things hot.
Super easy and tasty. Better then pizza.
Added spinach and mushrooms. Great breakfast took about 40 minutes in oven.
Loved it! Doubled the quantities and baked for 15 extra minutes. Quick and tasty!

Very good...and the name fits it...so super easy to make !!! Instead of bacon I used ham and since I didn't have the green onions...I used a regular onion and it came out great !! Thank you for sharing.
Very easy! I used dry onions instead of red pepper since I was out. The bacon I used was cooked the morning before. My whole family loved it!

Awesome recipe! Followed recipe as is, Substituted the bacon for meatless sausage & Baked for 25 minutes. We also added some extra cheese along with crushed up spicy doritos crumbled on top & baked for the last 2-5 minutes & This bake came out delicious! Even leftovers this morning were incredible. Saving this recipe to make again in the future! :)
Enjoyed the ease!
Will add more bacon next time but was still very tasty!
Delicious!
I made this fabulous recipe and everyone seriously loved it!
I added some mushrooms. Very good and so easy!

I made it for a brunch for a women’s potluck meeting and they loved it and none was left. I followed the suggestions of another review and doubled the recipe and added hash browns and Canadian bacon. I also used Hawaiian rolls instead of white bread. I made it the night before and baked it in the morning covered with aluminum foil for 45minutes.

My casserole looked better than this one but, unfortunately, it did not taste as good as it looked. This dish was too salty and the consistency of the eggs was grainy instead of fluffy. Cheese, bell pepper, onions, milk and black pepper amounts seemed right. Ham was a good substitute for bacon which can be rubbery when baked. Not sure why recipe has bread; 2 slices were too much and made for a weird, grainy texture. I did not use the optional garlic; it would not have improved this dish. I had to increase temp & cooking time; after 20 min at 350°, the dish was watery and hardly gelled so I increased temp to 400° and cooked dish for another 15 minutes. This worked - BUT then my lower oven temp might be off (although it worked well for 2-hour roast pork the other day). The recipe’s 9x13 pan size would have been too big for this small amount of ingredients (it would have produced a big pancake). I used an oval 7”x 9 ½” casserole dish and increased to 8 eggs and added one more T. milk. This seemed right. My cooked casserole was ¾” to 1” tall, which was still a little flatter than I would have liked. A bigger pan would have made it lower. I let it rest 10-15 min before serving.

I made something very similar to this using the cook times and temp accept I precook most of the ingredients accept for the eggs and cheese , I took frozen sausages and skinned the milk then sliced them into what looked like pepperoni sized only thicker pieces cooked them until about half cooked added yellow pepper and my pre-boiled potatoes cooking until the peppers begain to soften them added. Mushrooms and onions and garlic cooked for 5-7 mins tills the garlic smell was in the air . Removed from the pan into a 12x6 casserole dish cooked for 15 mins then added cheese cooked for 15mins more on 375
Excellent easy breakfast. My very picky son, who normally won't eat anything loved it. Best part it's super easy to make.

I made it my own by using a pasilla pepper (I don’t like the flavor of bell peppers), bacon crumbles from Costco, and I left out the garlic because I had to go to work afterwards. I didn’t have white bread, so I cubed some mini Thomas’ bagels. Sounds crazy, but the bagels were a great substitute bc they gave it another texture. I doubled the recipe and added 2 extra eggs. It was thicker than shown in the video, which was nice. It just took a little longer to fully cook the middle. Delicious & a great way to feed a crowd!
Very easy and kid approved added grated marble cheese, hot dogs, garlic and bread instead of some of the other ingredients

Made as the recipe stated with minor equal adjustments. Didn’t have green onions so I used 1/4 white onion, didn’t have red pepper, so I used a green one, and added a pinch of shredded fresh spinach. Turned out delicious except very small. Next time I’ll double the recipe or use a smaller pan. I was making it as a last minute item for a get-together, but it’s sooooo small.
I just made this and it was soooo good! I added mushrooms, I didn’t have any milk, still turned out yummy. Super easy to make

Easy recipe but does take some time chopping, grating etc. Made huge batch for 13 adults and one child. 30 eggs, 1 cup milk, 2 cups diced ham, 1 cup old cheddar, 8 chopped green onions, one full clove minced garlic, 1.5 sweet bell peppers, 4 italian herb panini buns diced. Made two large pans in about 40 mins at 350. Brunchers raved. Well worth the effort.
Sorry, 1 pound cheddar, also only a little more than one pan was eaten but we also had hashbrowns, bacon and french toast as sides.

Just starting out learning to cook and this was really nice to make! Had a pan that was a little too big, so used double the bacon so I guess it worked out! Going to try different fillings and see what happens!
I have made this a few times now and love it!! It makes a wonderful breakfast and I reheat it for a few days for a quick breakfast before work. It’s great reheated!
Easy and yummy
I sautéd the onions, peppers, and zucchini some mushrooms. Everyone loved this breakfast bake. I doubled the recipe for seven adults and it was the right amount.

Made this for a group recently and everyone loved it and asked for the recipe. I doubled the recipe but it was still pretty thin in a 9x13 pan. Next time I will triple the recipe. Changes made: cooked the bacon, added sauteed mushrooms, garlic, dry mustard plus extra cheese at the last minute. Best breakfast casserole I've ever made!
I put it in a small square dish but it was a big hit.
very easy to make. added extra bacon for my meat lovers!

This is similar to another recipe that you make in a crock pot. In any case, it's delicious. I make a big batch on Sundays, put it in the fridge, and bring a cup full to work with me each day for my breakfast. The scallion onions and red pepper give a bit of kick. I don't use real eggs but the liquid eggs that don't have any cholesterol. Two thumbs up!!

I read all the complaints about the bacon being soft, and need to tell you why. The recipe calls for bacon, but does not specify which kind. The video states Canadian bacon, that is ham for USA folks. Try ham, sausage, hamburger meat, or veggies and cheeses, and you will make this a family favorite.
Finally a delicious breakfast casserole with bacon! I partially pre-cooked the bacon and left the veggies and garlic out. Wonderful recipe- thanks for sharing!
I added some spicy brown mustard, and added slightly more milk.

This is fast and delicious! I didn't have green onions, so I microwaved white onions with the red pepper and a little grass-fed butter. I also didn't have bacon, so I used prociutto, so I cut the salt a little. I also used whole grain bread...yum! It is really good. I have tried a lot of egg casserole dishes, and this is one of my favorites!
This is a great recipe for feeding a big group, and tastes wonderful... For low carbs leave out the bread and cook on top of the stove... makes a great scramble.
Super easy ! made with croissants instead of bread. It was so good!
Delicious! I added Jalapenos on top on one side for my husband. :-)
Easy and delish. Subbed 24 frozen tater tots for 2 slices of bread and it worked. Baked it 5 more minutes.
Pan size is wrong... unless you want it 1/2 inch thick. I prefer it thicker so a smaller pan. I also prefer to sauté my veggies prior to baking. Bacon needs to be pre-cooked (not stated in recipe).

I had a group of 12 over after church. Made two pans - one with crumbled breakfast sausage and one with chopped ham steak. Everyone LOVED it! I served it with sour cream and salsa on the side, fresh fruit and small danishes! Easy and delicious. :)
Delicious and so easy

I really liked it! I did alter it a bit. I was looking for a little healthier so I swapped out milk and used almond milk. I have quite a few people in the house so I did 10 eggs, 1/2 a red bell and 1/2 a green pepper. I put a thin layer of hashbrowns on the bottom and used a pound of uncured bacon. Cut up most and laid 4 pieces on top. It was excellent and a hit!
